meanings.definition: A medication taken before a meal to prevent nausea or other side effects.
meanings.sent1: I always carry a prepill in my bag in case I feel sick after eating.
meanings.sent2: The doctor prescribed a prepill to help with my stomach issues.
meanings.sent3: The prepill jumped out of the bottle and danced on the table, trying to avoid being swallowed.
meanings.sent4: Her prepill was like a shield, protecting her from the discomfort of a heavy meal.
meanings.sent5: The prepill was a tiny hero, fighting off the nausea monster after dinner.

meanings.definition: To take a pill before a meal for preventive purposes.
meanings.sent1: Before dinner, she would prepill to avoid feeling sick later.
meanings.sent2: He always prepills before going out to eat to stay healthy.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to prepill before the meal, just in case it was too spicy.
meanings.sent4: She would prepill her worries away, ensuring a peaceful dining experience.
meanings.sent5: Prepill like a pro to keep those tummy troubles at bay!
